page.title: 08MY DAD'S BUSINESS
page.content: My dad has had a business which has been passed down through families for years. It has gone from grandparent to parent to sons. My grandparents business started with steam traction engines and repairs. They had two Threshing engines ,a Fowler ,a Burrell and two threshers ,all driven by steam. Later on when petrol and paraffin was invented ,tractors came into use. The tractor used was a{ {Foddson Major.}This was used for threshing. Later on a roller was bought to roll roads. Today we use J.C.B's. A J.C.B is a digging machine. It has a back bucket which digs foundations, and a front bucket is used for leveling out top soil. The width is 8 foot and the length is 12 foot. It weighs about 2-4 tonnes. We now have 2 of these J.C.B's.
